articles.author: David Shepardson, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: China's embassy in Washington on Tuesday defended its business practices after U.S. Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo said U.S. firms had told her that China had become "uninvestible."
articles.title: China, in response to US's Raimondo, says it is easing market access for foreign firms

articles.author: Lewis Krauskopf
articles.description: Nvidia Corp’s (NVDA.O) soaring rally has thrilled investors this year - except for the sizeable number of fund managers who avoided what they believe to be an expensive stock.
articles.title: Analysis: Funds punished for owning too few Nvidia shares after stunning 230% rally

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A U.S. judge has rejected Burger King's bid to dismiss a lawsuit claiming that it cheated hungry customers by making its Whopper sandwich appear larger than it actually is.
articles.title: Burger King must face lawsuit claiming its Whoppers are too small

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Denmark's Orsted (ORSTED.CO), the world's largest offshore wind farm developer, said on Wednesday it may see U.S. impairments of 16 billion Danish crowns ($2.3 billion) due to supply chain problems, soaring interest rates and a lack of new tax credits.
articles.title: Orsted plunges 20% on risk of $2.3 billion in US impairments

articles.author: Kailyn Rhone
articles.description: Pediatricians and parents are calling for the U.S. to treat new high-caffeine energy drinks like alcohol and cigarettes and ban their sale to minors as a single serving can contain as much caffeine as six Coca-Colas.
articles.title: Rising caffeine levels spark calls for ban on energy drink sales to children

articles.author: Lucila Sigal
articles.description: Argentina is battling against triple digit inflation, its highest in over three decades, and that could climb to near 200% by the end of the year, stirring memories of hyperinflation in the late 1980s and other economic crises.
articles.title: As inflation soars, Argentines say they've seen this film before

articles.author: Maria Cardona, Marco Bello
articles.description: Hurricane Idalia made landfall in Florida as an "extremely dangerous" Category 3 storm on Wednesday after millions of residents evacuated or hunkered down in homes and shelters to await the arrival of a life-threatening storm surge.
articles.title: Hurricane Idalia makes landfall on Florida's coast

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Wednesday that the investigation into the plane crash which killed mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin included the possibility that it was caused deliberately, its first explicit acknowledgement that he may have been assassinated.
articles.title: Kremlin says Prigozhin plane crash may have been caused deliberately

articles.author: Tife Owolabi
articles.description: Nigerian police raided an alleged gay wedding, which is illegal in the country, in the southern city of Warri in Delta state, and arrested 67 people, authorities said in a statement, following a tipoff from a person who knew of the event.
articles.title: Nigerian police raid alleged gay wedding, arrest 67 people
